column4: petskull: you might look for synaptic or apt-get peg  to peg to a version to the one you want
but I want to keep 2.62
I like using it
but I only need to open meshes in 2.49 and export them as Ogre meshes
sorry I think it's pinning not peg http://jaqque.sbih.org/kplug/apt-pinning.html
but won't that not let me run 2.62?
oh I thought you want the older version installed not the new one,  you want both?
yes
both
then I'm not sure about that,  I guess I would compile the later one into local/bin and the older from the repository
just download the tarball and install it?
then you put the full path to the one you want at the time
it depends on the software if it requires compile and what dependencies but there might be other ways
yeah, I actually thought about that, but I was looking for a better way
'cause installing from tarballs is always a mess
dependency hell, etc
I have about 3 different firefox installed with that method but not recomended for all users.  but for real bleading you normaly need to compile anyway
normaly bleading edge stuf is not tarballs anymore we get them from github or svn
yeah, I don't need anything like that
remind you with git you have full control over every possible version and branch in bettween every release forward and backward
holy fucking awesome- no compile required
it's got an executable binary
what that a question or an observation?  if it's ruby or java , perl, python ... then no it wouldn't  require any compile but normaly still have dependancies
observation
